DOC.brief_summary: The propose research provide in-depth , longitudinal data , base real-time report , address key priority FDA include , increase understanding relation electronic cigarette ( e-cig ) use 1 ) nicotine dependence , 2 ) reduction combustible cigarette ( CC ) use , 3 ) attempt quit CC use success attempt , 4 ) health-related outcome biomarkers exposure carcinogenicity .
DOC.brief_title: E-Cigarettes : Dynamic Patterns Use Health Effects
DOC.detailed_description: Primary Aim : Characterize e-cig use pattern acutely 2 year relate pattern CC use ( include reduce CC use ) , nicotine dependence relate variable ( e.g. , withdrawal suppression ) , attempt success quit CC use . Investigators use ecological momentary assessment ( EMA ) obtain fine grain , real-time data e-cig CC use . These data use test hypothesis increase high level e-cig use , measure real-time , negatively related CC use , nicotine dependence , CC withdrawal severity positively related CC quit attempt CC cessation success . Secondary Aim 1 : Determine use e-cigs related biomarkers tobacco exposure cancer risk , acute chronic pulmonary health outcome . Investigators examine relation e-cig use cancer biomarkers , exposure biomarkers , pulmonary function . Secondary Aim 2 : Identify person factor , contextual variable , pattern behavior symp-toms predict e-cig CC use pattern key outcome ( e.g. , CC cessation , health-related outcome ) , identify variable moderate relation e-cig use outcome . Investigators attempt identify contextual variable person factor predict increase e-cig use , decrease CC use ( include cessation ) , reduce nicotine dependence , significant change biomarkers health outcome . Further , investigator identify variable moderate relation , reveal factor event make change e-cig CC use , associate outcome , especially likely .

Individuals meet one inclusion criterion . Those meet one ( ) criteria 15 either criterion 6a 6b exclude .
